acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to the University of Virginia Library by C. Brian Kelly, Charlottesville, Virginia, on May 16, 1997.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: C. Brian Kelly, of Charlottesville, Virginia, is a former journalist, magazine editor, columnist for Military Historymagazine, and University of Virginia English professor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the papers of C. Brian Kelly, ca. 45 items, ca. 1993-1997, consists of book covers, dust jackets, publicity material, and book reviews for publications written and published by Kelly and his wife, Ingrid Smyer-Kelly; articles by Kelly; and related material. These include Tales of the Clubhouse Cat (Cont.) A Christmas Tale at That!and books in the series called Best Little Stories from the Civil War, Best Little Stories from the White House, and Best Little Stories from World War II. Articles by Kelly include: "1864 Holiday Was Bleak for the South" in The Washington Times; three Best Little Storiesexcerpts in Military History; and "Log Homes were Presidents' Pride" in Country's Best Log Homes. C. Brian Kelly and his wife, Ingrid Smyer-Kelly, teamed up to form Montpelier Publishing which published the Best Little Storiesseries and other works.
